sense.name: Avoid one's assigned duties.
sense.commentary: Note: Possibly derived from Nero's fiddling at Rome; negative connotation of Sense 3. Includes: FIDDLE ABOUT
sense.examples: The derelict soldier fiddled his duties. Don't just fiddle about - do something!

sense.name: Commit fraud and steal from one's employer.
sense.examples: We found out that she's been fiddling for years. He'd been fiddling from the company all along.

sense.name: Play the fiddle or similar instrument.
sense.examples: Zuckerman fiddled that song very nicely. He fiddled all night to the joy of the crowd. You can fiddle on the violin, too.

sense.name: Manipulate physically or with one's imagination.
sense.examples: The reporter fiddled with the facts, trying to make a story. Someone fiddled with the documents on my desk. Don't fiddle with the screws. He fiddled with the idea of running for the Senate. He fiddled with his wedding ring while waiting in the ER. Can you fiddle with the T.V. set?
